newsitem.title: UK: British government finances improve in July.
newsitem.headline: British government finances improve in July.

text.p: The British government gathered in 3.875 billion pounds ($6.2 billion) more in tax in July than it spent on public services, official figures showed on Monday.
The figure was much better than the 1.9 billion pounds forecast by analysts.

Sheetal Radia, analyst with MMS International, said: "This figure is a lot better than we expected and the data highlights how strongly the economic cycle is affecting tax revenues and how strong the consumer sector is."
There were no privatisation proceeds but receipts from Value Added Tax of 5.032 billion pounds were the highest since records began, the figures from the Office of National Statistics showed.
The London stock market extended its recovery from early losses after the public sector debt repayment figure came in above forecast.
